website_summaries.verdict: It might be the answer for small jobs, but the other units can handle jobs of any size for a modest increase in price.
pros: A small unit for small jobs
Trigger locks, and the unit holds pressure well
Can be used to mist or spray
cons: Gaskets and o-rings are prone to failure
The unit is not durable and breaks easily

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for dog bark deterrent
customer_reviews.text: I have a 24' deck and use spray bottles to discourage Bella Mozzarella, my Boston Terrier Pug mix from barking at everything that moves down below. This covers the spread perfectly. I have bought a couple more for gifts.
customer_reviews.author: VinceInVA

customer_reviews.title: THESE DO NOT LAST
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one for a10% bleach solution. It started leaking after a couple of months. I ordered another from Amazon. In addition, I ordered replacement gaskets from Solo. Installed them on the defective sprayer. Still leaks, but not as bad. The replacement sprayer is now leaking. In addition, it will not shut off after spraying. My wife had to unscrew it to relieve the pressure. I'm not going to buy a third unit. They work great when the work. The problem is they stop working
customer_reviews.author: Jim Henry

customer_reviews.title: Good for automotive work
customer_reviews.text: These little sprayers are built pretty well. I bought a few to use for automotive work, spraying window tint solutions, and paint sealants... Only thing I did was take off the little draft shield, as it made adjusting the spray pattern particularly hard. Can be adjusted from a hard scream, to a fine mist. Overall I'm impressed with this sprayer
customer_reviews.author: N. Lorenzoni

customer_reviews.title: Did not last one quart of water!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one a year ago and it was great for a season... I replaced that one it leaked. This new one has the same water in side for three weeks sitting on a table, used it today, and leaked all over me! Almost a year later May 24, 2018 went to use for the first time for the session, now it has a suction issue! It will not pump. Took it apart, cleaned and got the chemicals all over me again! Now I am really pissed off. I want to talk to this vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Black

customer_reviews.title: Just Exploded!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this sprayer up till today when it exploded with a loud bang. My ears are still ringing. I've had it for almost 3 years and used daily to mist plants with plain water. I don't mind things wearing out but don't expect them to go out like this. Glad I just had water in the sprayer and not a harmful chemical as I ended up with a face full. I had just pumped 4X.After this experience, I'm going to opt for another brand, hopefully more durable.
customer_reviews.author: CarolSchrillo

customer_reviews.title: Used to love em!!
customer_reviews.text: I really used to like these sprayers. They can take a lot of abuse and still keep working. We use them for spraying cement color on carved cement rock.. But after you're done with them and we always clean them out properly, when we go to use them again they won't hold air pressure..the nozzles leak..etc.. So our company went back to using the Chapin hand-held sprayers. It sucks,,because wh they work the Solo shoots a more consistent spray pattern!
customer_reviews.author: stuccoguy

customer_reviews.title: Worked.... twice
customer_reviews.text: Highly disappointed with this product, sorry to say. I thought this would replace the 'disposable' ones I purchase at the dollar and hardware stores. For the price I thought I finally found something good that would last. All I needed it for was to spray vinegar onto weeds to kill them off. As I said, it worked two times and now will no longer get any pressure in the bottom section. No longer sprays; not even a dribble. :'(
customer_reviews.author: Dreadlover

customer_reviews.title: Save Your Money
customer_reviews.text: Worked twice then started leaking and won't hold pressure. Tried disassembly, oiling, etc. Nothing works short of buying a new gasket kit. Unit only 6 months old, buy something better
customer_reviews.author: Mark Olmstead

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: I saw an auto detailer using a similar product in an online demo and thought it was a great idea. I buy tire/wheel cleaner (shameless plug for the P21S stuff) in gallon jugs to save money so I needed a separate spray bottle. That works fine, but if I'm washing my car, my wife's car and my daughter's car - my hand gets tired squeezing the spray bottle trigger. Pump up the Solo sprayer and you're good to go! I think it would be great for any household cleaners you buy in bulk (window cleaner, etc.) and use regularly.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: Leaks Heavily
customer_reviews.text: This product functioned great...for one week. Then it would no longer hold pressure.. blowing the liquid back out around the plunger, spilling its contents all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: Fran Kieb

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I live in a very peaceful and quiet neighborhood. All of us use battery powered or self powered lawn tools. I needed to wash my car, and of course being in the neighborhood I am in, it is frowned upon using too much water or making too much noise. This was perfect. I was able to wash my car and rinse it off using this item and only two gallons of water. Can't wait to use it for other tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Holland

customer_reviews.title: Used to be great, quality has gone down hill
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional house cleaner and have been using this model of sprayer for years and the quality in the last year or so has tanked. I used to get about a year out of these before seals went bad. The last two I’ve gotten have leaked from day one at the nozzle pivot. I never over pump or over fill, and even at half pumps it streams out of the sides of the pivot. Makes it unusable for anything containing bleach, and all in all makes a big mess. I understand that I can’t expect NASA quality for $15, but this is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: RKKopra

customer_reviews.title: For that "Fresh from the DeCon" feeling
customer_reviews.text: After a quick sprint to the grocery, family members can give my rain suit a quick dilute-bleach spray-down with this. Great for freshening up packages and entryways as well. The pump bottle is large enough for a thorough decontamination, but small enough to wield and requires only the minimum amount of solution per use. Excellent ergonomics, even a child can use it. The plastic is thick and rugged, and the pump mechanism feels solid. It holds pressure well. Since it is not actually meant for bleach solutions, we empty it after each use and flush it with water.
customer_reviews.author: amazon_princessTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Find a better sprayer!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice sprayer and I would’ve rated it higher if the nozzle would shut off. When you pump up sprayer and press the button in the closed position the product will start to spray. There is a small nozzle that you unscrew to control the width of the spray but when you go to shut it all the way off and press that nozzle the product will still dispense. Therefore if a child gets a hold of this or you accidentally press that button it will leak out. I would find another brand. Also the spray nozzle tip is made of plastic not metal.
customer_reviews.author: amazonreviewer

customer_reviews.title: Best sprayer I have used
customer_reviews.text: Love this. With a large sprayer, I always end up with product I have to dump. I garden organically, and I sometimes need to spray powders like diatomaceous earth that clog the sprayer if solution is not agitated frequently. This produces the best adjustable spray of any small sprayer I have owned. It is easy to shake frequently to keep powders in suspension. It is highly maneuverable and spray can be directed for use in the greenhouse and for covering all leaf surfaces. I mix neem, soap, diatomaceous earth and sometimes spinosad for a broad spectrum pest and antifungal spray. Little danger to beneficials if you are careful not to use spinosad when bees are active.
customer_reviews.author: A. Goldsmith

customer_reviews.title: Great for sanitizing against viruses
customer_reviews.text: With all of the spray sanitizers already purchased, I was looking for a pump sprayer that would put out a fine mist. The intent was to see it it would properly, with a fine mist spay a film that would kill the Corona 19 viruses along with Cold and Flu viruses. We mix 1 tablespoon of 6% chlorine bleach per liter of water and mist everything in our Town's courtroom. That level will kill any virus including COVID 19. My concern was that it would not mist the emulsion good enough but it is perfect. This offers a cheap inexpensive and potent way of sanitizing handrails metal detectors, seats....... the entire courtroom.
customer_reviews.author: Warren

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Washing Cars!
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for something that makes it easy to soak up my car without paying alot or cramping my hands. Water compressor are expensive to buy, not including getting the attachments and soup for the machine. I use special car soap that does spray alot of soap on the car but I'm sure if you use dish soap or something with a little more foam it will work a lot better when it come to foaming up the car. Over all I am happy with this purchase and hope it does last for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Stops fine mist
customer_reviews.text: I am so tired of having to order these over and over. I have purchased many that have went right in the trash can. They all have stopped spraying correctly after six to twelve months. I have taken the sprayer parts apart and cleaned them a dozen times and it has not made any of them work. They stop spraying in the fine mist and either come out just pouring liquid or don’t spray at all. I use these in the house all the time and need the fine spray mist. How do you repair the nozzle because I have lost so much money having to keep throwing them out and repurchasing them.
customer_reviews.author: Morrie

customer_reviews.title: Great little sprayer!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two sprayers - this one liter and a two liter. Both have worked great over the past few months. Easy to fill - easy to maneuver, easy to spray, easy to clean. Spray is adjustable and works like a charm to cover our vegetable garden plants with light, consistent coverage of BT pest control solution. Of the two sprayers I think I prefer this one as it is smaller and when filled more lightweight and therefore easier for us to use. Very happy with purchase - would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: dpb

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Quality of Life improvement
customer_reviews.text: Makes cleaning tasks easier as soap is spread abundantly and evenly. It says 30 strokes to pressurize but have produced adequate pressure and spray with only several pumps. Have also used it to disinfect canned or wrapped groceries during this pandemic. Windows, counters, bathroom, carpet, spot treating clothes and everything else. Soap type matters as to how much foam comes out. Some work better than others. Can't fully attest to the durability as it was just recently purchased but have used it extensively in the past couple of weeks and seems to be standing up to the tasks.
customer_reviews.author: jinha

customer_reviews.title: Get a fresh batch each application
customer_reviews.text: Very handy little sprayer, I measured one quart into it and used a marker to the quart line since this is a one liter bottle, for ease in measuring my organic foliar sprays. It works great, easy to use and can use all of it in one day so i can make it fresh batch each time I am spraying. I used to use the bigger gallon and two gallon ones, but always had leftover stuff and was afraid it was losing it's strength in our Florida heat and humidity, this way I love that I can make a fresh batch each time.
customer_reviews.author: D. BrownTop Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: ... out and lasted a couple of years which is fantastic for the price
customer_reviews.text: Used for the animal shelter I worked out and lasted a couple of years which is fantastic for the price. I used harsh cleaners in one of these that I bought and I can confirm that it did not rust or damage any of the components. The products I used during a 3 year term include: + 1:32 bleach and 1:10 bleach + Trifectant and Virkon S + Quaternary ammonium compounds such as triple two All of the above chemicals sprayed out at the rate desired and without any loss of function. I particularly liked the option to change the way it was being sprayed from a mist to a straight line.
customer_reviews.author: SiamicTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Was excited until i received mine.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to mix with my waterless car wash product. Have been hearing lots of good review about this sprayer from detailers, but i must say i am very dissapointed. Spray seems like its leaking a little while using it for the first time. Not sure if it got damage upon shipping or its specifically what i received because of factory defect. My home depot sprayer works the same for 10 dollar less. Def not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: WGT

customer_reviews.title: Great little sprayer
customer_reviews.text: The quality and performance of this sprayer was a pleasant surprise. I ordered this to mix & apply Wet and Forget to small sections of my steps, walks and driveway that get a little mossy. It works really well and adjusting the spray is simple. It's compact, but holds about 25% more than the one-liter rating with no problem. Because I don't need extensive coverage, I chose this smaller unit and fill it a few times rather than take up space with a large sprayer that I use once or twice a year. If I had large coverage areas, I would opt for the larger unit or a big sprayer. I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: asb

customer_reviews.title: Use for Neem oil application
customer_reviews.text: I have some medium-size potted fruit trees that I used to spray down with neem oil in a regular spray bottle. This pressure sprayer makes it so much easier! It is quick to pump up before spraying and has a very even spray. The ability to lock the trigger in place is great for a large application as well. I have also used this to mist my small potted succulents to avoid over watering. I use it more often than my 2 gallon pressure sprayer because it is so convenient to store and I don't need to mix up a large batch of whatever it is that I am using.
customer_reviews.author: natalie.b.

customer_reviews.title: Great little sprayer for microgreens
customer_reviews.text: This is especially much more convenient in spraying and moistening dry soil or for watering plants It beats a hand pump spay bottle which takes forever to use. Tilt sprayer head makes it very easy to spray flat soil surface that you're unable to tilt forward. One issue which isn't really an issue is you can't fill it up to the top, because it works off of air pressure- not liquid pressure. The lower the liquid level, the more pumps and sustained stream you get. When not in use, I always unscrew the top (and release the pressure) to get a longer life out of the seal.
customer_reviews.author: WayneG

customer_reviews.title: bad design/materials
customer_reviews.text: Worked great in the beginning. The pump stopped working because the valve is made out of some cheap leather which dried up and was no longer able to keep the air pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Gee Smart

customer_reviews.title: love it. makes cleaning and etc when lots of spraying is involved
customer_reviews.text: i REALLY like this thing. it makes cleaning and spraying solutions so easy. usually after using a squeeze sprayer bottle to get the entire walk in shower, the trigger fingers feel fatigued about halfway through. now i don't even think about it, and it does the job so much faster. just give it a dozen or so pumps and it sprays for a good while. i've seen it used at the kids school too, where teachers use it to cool kids when outside in the hot sun for events as well. great idea. will buy another for that (humid days in hawaii) so i don't use the bottle that also holds bleach on the kids. :)
customer_reviews.author: dc

customer_reviews.title: Window tinters best friend! Great for many uses!
customer_reviews.text: I use this everyday, honestly. It's a great tool and very durable, I backed over the pump handle with my Jeep and thankfully it withstood the punch. Also I've dropped it several times while tinting windows. The best thing about this is the ability to increase pressure via the pump but also the wide range of spray control the nozzle gives you while still maintaining the pressure you need. I can spray the rear glass of a small car without having to turn sideways or soak the dash. I also use it for tinting commercial windows which is great because the tank holds enough to make several passes.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett H.

customer_reviews.title: Forget using this item for household bleach.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this sprayer for the first 2 months I had it. It's the right size for spraying bleach in bathrooms, showers, etc., but for the past 2 or 3 weeks I noticed dripping from the nozzle. I've cleaned it by running gallons of very hot water through it. I took it apart and cleaned the nozzle, and I tried as best I could to clean the valve area that appears to allow the leaking. That one little valve appears to be the week link, and I don't believe it can be replaced. I specifically ordered this item because it was supposed to handle harsh household chemicals, and I only used it for household bleach.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen L. Evilsizor

customer_reviews.title: Leaks real good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product and was initially so impressed, I ordered one for my son. BUT, then after about one month of about 10 uses, it leaked and failed to hold pressure. The pump will not hold in the down position and the liquid simply leaks out of the top until it is fully depressurized. A good idea gone bad.
customer_reviews.author: James Wallin

customer_reviews.title: Very nice sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use with a micro-sized shop vac for treating carpet stains (I use hot water and a drop of soap in the sprayer). The sprayer seems really solid, well made, and it works well for this. There is one reviewer who noted their sprayer leaked and didn't last long, however the review mentions they were using bleach in it. Bleach can dissolve the gaskets and some of the parts in any sprayer not designed for it, so I don't think this is really a fair criticism of the Solo sprayer. Overall this seems like a great sprayer and I am quite happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: ctx1050

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I used it for spraying a fine mist of a diluted bleach solution for cleaning. It was about 20% bleach and 80% distilled water. It lasted less than 3 months. Now, it won't spray a fine mist anymore. It will still shoot a stream of liquid, but that's not what I want. If you're using less corrosive chemicals, it might last longer. And if you don't care about spraying a fine mist, then this sprayer should work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Miles L.

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BELIEVE THE 4.4 RATING!!!  I've had 5 of these!
customer_reviews.text: This pump sprayer is a temporary product at best. The 1,400+ reviews must be based on a casual use. I purchased these for more frequent use in a sign shop where I spray large sign panels and decals for their application with a water/soap solution . Over time with the repeated tightening of the sprayer/pump in the bottle the sprayer loses its seal and consequently any pressure pumped. I have one left of the 5 purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Red1rider

customer_reviews.title: Built for the long haul
customer_reviews.text: People complain about the effectiveness of this pump changing with time. First, pour your source water through a filter, using a Britta for example. Secondly, ALWAYS loosen the cover when done, to relieve internal pressure. This is said to greatly prolong the seal life. I've had mine for about a half year, and it works like new. There is, by the way, a small fine screen filter that should be rinsed on occasion as well. I don't know if I'd leave the pump with any water in it near a window as algae may start to grow, and that's certainly no fault of the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Anton Stayduhar

customer_reviews.title: Best ever...
customer_reviews.text: I’d been using regular spay bottles for ever and it alway hurt my hands after couple of minutes. I have arthritis and this came, after watching abroad tv show, which I never thought of it huh??? I bought 2 of these for spraying many of my plants and ethyl alcohol to disinfect things around house. This is the best ever. The cup device prevents spraying water all over around plants, for disinfect, I could focus on certain points...... I need to get some more for myself, my older sister and daughter who also has many plants!
customer_reviews.author: Applejax

customer_reviews.title: Total C-R-A-P....no one makes a decent sprayer!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: bought two....a big and small. used them for soaps, degreasers etc. 3-6 months. NOW THEY ARE JUNK! Pump them up, and foam pours out the top where the plunger is. Oiled it with mineral oil, let soak did everything I could and wish some one would make ANY decent sprayer. Even my SOLO backpack sprayer barely sprays, or pumps up for a strong stream or mist!! And it gets washed out constantly. SOLO like many products today talks a mean game, but in reality is just junk after a year or so. and I'm just using these at home.....feel sorry for commercial users.
customer_reviews.author: Jettywolf

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my small garden and so easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Most people recommend a 1 gallon size pump sprayer, but I found that this 1L size was perfect for my small backyard garden. It checked all the boxes for me - it's lightweight, easy to maneuver, and easy to clean in the sink. I found that I rarely needed more than 1L for foliar sprays or administering sprays for pest control. I've tried the HDX 1 gallon sprayer from Home Depot and experienced leaking. Have not had any problems with this sprayer and have recommended this to others.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany C.

customer_reviews.title: Using for Ball Python Enclosure
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace a name-brand reptile mister that had an awful chemical smell. This was cheaper and is much more functional. Free flow/pause buttons for the mist are smooth and easy to reach while misting. I love the bell, puts out a finer mist that previous purchase, one or two plunger dips and you're good to go- you don't have to pump it for ages and it pumps SUPER smooth. The size is perfect- my name brand mister was twice the size and bulky with cheap plastic handles- it'd wear your wrist out if using for an extended period of time. This one is light weight, super ergonomic, and fits less awkwardly into the terrarium.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little sprayer for tubs and showers!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace a broken Scrubbing Bubbles automatic shower cleaner. This is even better and easier than I hoped for! If you use a trigger spray bottle with any kind of shower cleaner, I highly suggest you get this. You know how you have to pull the trigger like 20 times to spray your whole shower/tub area? Not with this. Pour the cleaner in, pump it a few times until it's pressurized and then, voila! You pull the trigger and hold it and move it around the shower/tub walls. Could not be easier. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mesla

customer_reviews.title: Your plants will love this
customer_reviews.text: This is great for misting plants especially because it has a directional spray so you can spray the underside of the leaves. The mist is very fine. It will also be good for ironing those summer cottons and linens. The pump means that you do not have to cramp your thumb pumping. Pump it up thoroughly and just press the button to release a fine mist. The 1 quart size is just a little heavy but not too much, though I would have preferred a smaller jug.
customer_reviews.author: Sagefemme

customer_reviews.title: Great hand held sprayer. Minor niggles.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent build quality. Easy to adjust and use. I’ve owned several different brands of handheld sprayers, and this is the nicest of them. The trigger is a little “too easy” to use. It’s easy to bump whole not spraying and inadvertently spray something. This is a minor complaint, and has more to do with user lack of focus than anything else. Lock on feature is nice, but hardly necessary on a 1qt sprayer. All in all, highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Scott Rybarik

customer_reviews.title: Works Very Well
customer_reviews.text: I bought a previous sprayer from Amazon for indoor house plants (I have a lot of plants). I had to return it for a few reasons mostly it leaked, adjustable nozzle didn't adjust. This sprayer is way better, no leaks, adjusts better. The only change to the product I would make is to include another nozzle that fits on the end to adjust the radius of the spray to either more focused or broader. For indoor house plants this sprayer works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: David Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Good product, BUT it needs a lock to prevent accidents
customer_reviews.text: Great sprayer for car care products. I've also used to spray vinegar water on exterior windows. Not recommended for large volume spraying. Good quality and far less expensive than the metal rechargeable cans. It lacks a safety lock. I've sprayed tire cleaner in my face twice while removing from storage.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Small Enough for the Bath Room
customer_reviews.text: Used to spray daily shower "keep clean". Have had three others of a different brand that developed leaks. Have had this one only a 1.5 months so will watch it carefully and update this review if it fails in anyway within say the next year or so. One thing I like about it that is different then the other three is that you can set the spray to super fine or heavier. Could not get fine out of the other three.
customer_reviews.author: JD Combs

customer_reviews.title: Used for all house plants!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I have about 60 plants of various sizes in my home and this mister is wonderful! fill it, pump it a few times and then spray away. Super convenient and easy to use, no setup needed. As for cons, well i guess its a bummer that you cant change the mist level or range but that is the least of my concerns and honestly, something i would have not noticed unless i didnt read it from another review. Over all if you have plants you mist constantly, this is a great product for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannea707

customer_reviews.title: So fun to use to water plants
customer_reviews.text: My kids and I love watering the plants. The outdoor ones get the hose. The indoor ones get this sprayer. The pump is easy to use and you can adjust the spray type from a stream to a shower to a mist. It's great. It's not too heavy for a 6-year-old if she waters for just a minute or two and holds with both hands -- or maybe she's just saying that so she can water the plants with this cool sprayer. haha.
customer_reviews.author: Christine X

customer_reviews.title: Great stream and mist. Does not spray.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the sprayer is pretty good, except that it doesn't spray. The nozzle adjusts from mist to stream with nothing in between. You either get fine droplets or a stream that knocks the leaves around and the fluid runs off onto the ground. Pro: The locking trigger is great. It only leaves 2 tablespoons of fluid in the bottom. The stream can go 20 feet--great in a water fight. Con: There is no spray setting on the nozzle. The drip guard gets in the way of adjusting the stream. Need more volume markings on the side of the container. There is no pressure relief value. I am going to look for another sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 uses. Do NOT waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Did NOT last! Died after 2nd use. Description specifically states gaskets and seals are made to withstand harsh chemical use. They did not. I find that misleading and fraudulent. I trusted the description to be accurate and as a result wasted my money on this. Now it's useless and will not spray anything. 2 uses. Garbage.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brackett

customer_reviews.title: Spraying Frenzy
customer_reviews.text: Bought for spraying shower and tub cleaner instead of the endless squeezing of a spray bottle. How in the world did I live without these?? They are awesome. So far they are holding up well to the cleaners I have in them. I don't see any degradation of the seals etc. Would be very handy for older people or someone with mild arthritis in their hands. Highly recommend! PS: ALWAYS label what you have in a spray bottle of any kind if there's not a factory label on it.
customer_reviews.author: RDSWY4

customer_reviews.title: Works great till it doesnt
customer_reviews.text: I'm a sculptor and need to keep my materials damp. This has worked really well for me, but little by little it's begun to behave erratically. Now It wont work at all. When i pump it, there is no pressure, just pump and pump and nothing. As if there is some leak somewhere and air is getting out. But I've had it for several years. Maybe that's to be expected...?
customer_reviews.author: Gooshlem

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!  Please bring it back.
customer_reviews.text: The best part is the multi-directional nozzle. You can get that on a much larger sprayer with a separate spray wand, but this is one has it on a pump sprayer bottle. The best idea! I use it to apply rug cleaning solution so am always spraying down. But with multi-directional nozzle, I can keep bottle upright so solution completely empties from bottle. Didn't realize how great this was until I went to local hardware store to get another bottle for same purpose. But no multi-directional nozzle, and more expensive. Heavy duty plastic bottle. Overall well made. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really handy tool. More uses than just paint and stain.
customer_reviews.text: We got this to use with our Semco Teak Sealer, and it's been really handy for that, but actually, it's good for spraying any liquid we've wanted, using it for the fungus spray for our plants as well as other applications I can't quite remember right now. The head angles to help your aim and its very comfortable to use. Just be sure you thoroughly clean it our after use or you'll wind up with a clogged nozzle that you may not be able to clear. I spray hot water after use to make sure it will be good to go. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Lilley

customer_reviews.title: Faulty construction w/no manufacturer support.
customer_reviews.text: Having owned four of these, I feel qualified to add a review. Solo sprayer #1 lasted for a few years, so I thought a second one would be as good... not so, but I kept it it for a week beyond the return limit, so I ordered a third. Solo #3 failed on the first use, so I exchanged it for another from Amazon. Solo #4 was also defective. Between #s 2 & 3, I attempted to contact Solo directly by email. A canned email promised a response... none was received. I’ve got no good words for Solo, but Amazon is golden, as they refunded my money.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Love this sprayer
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use. Pump has a locking mechanism that prevents unwanted spraying and also has a lock to keep spraying without holding down trigger. The pump stem is very durable and shouldn't have any issues with breakage. I advise to be careful not to touch the pump stem, there's grease on there that is very important to keep the pumping mechanism in working order, I highly suggest buying more grease even though I haven't need to reapply in several grow seasons. Just a suggestion if you lose grease from accidental touching the mechanism.
customer_reviews.author: T.E.G

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to spray deer repellent after the sprayer on the deer repellent stopped working after a couple of uses. My only regret is that I did not buy a larger size Solo sprayer. Anyway this one works well: it has an easily removable top so the liquid can be poured in and the spray pattern is adjustable. Just pour in the liquid, give the bottle a few pumps and you're ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a professional house cleaner, and have developed a bad case of tennis elbow. I believe my injury has been caused by pulling the trigger on spray bottles over a million times a day! I thought what I really needed was some way of dispersing the cleaning solution without a trigger. BAM! This product works fantastic for spreading cleaning solutions on surfaces. I only wish I had thought of this sooner. I'm very happy with how it works. Hopefully I'll soon see an improvement with my elbows.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great sprayer, if you have big hands.
customer_reviews.text: The pump and sprayer assembly is well-engineered and very robust. The adjustable sprayer head works very well, however I wish I could get a little finer mist sometimes. The only actual issue I have with the product is the bottle/container potrtion. It's too wide to easily grip. The little feet on the bottom aren't big enough to help me twist it open either and it's just hard to refill it-- especially considering how little 1L of liquid actually is.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin Hay

customer_reviews.title: BEST sprayer EVER! Powerful spray, yet quiet - no drip - adjustable sprayer nozzle with shield is brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: BEST sprayer EVER! I bought this to mix up an herbal fly spray for my horses and it works perfectly for this purpose. The spray is fine enough that I didn't get dripping, I got really good even coverage and the adjustable sprayer nozzle with shield was awesome when I did the horse's belly. The spray is quiet enough that it didn't spook my horse and powerful enough that I didn't have to stand right up next to her as I sprayed. I would definitely recommend this product and plan to buy another one or two to have on hand for various spraying purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda L Vance

customer_reviews.title: I got two of those ..
customer_reviews.text: I think this product can benefit a lot from a rubber seal within the pump assembly. Many times I had to over tighten the top and finally, I had added Teflon tape around the thread to prevent pressure leak. this is not coincidental, it happening on the two sprayers I bought. Also, the product could benefit from a pressure relief valve so you can easily open if under pressure. I am now using a Teflon tape around the thread to tighten the pressure..
customer_reviews.author: Horse Rider

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Pump is well lubricated inside making pumping action smooth and nearly effortless. I bought this for my self but i think my mother will also enjoy it spraying all sorts of stuff with it. Adjustable spray pattern and very very easy to pump and spray mechanism made to fit your hand like a glove is perfect for any application. It wold be nice if it had some sort of extended nozzle. Maye i can rig up a tube and put a nozzle of it instead, looks like that can be made rather easy due to the tip design. Otherwise its a great unit.
customer_reviews.author: Tonycstech

customer_reviews.title: Great sprayer!!!
customer_reviews.text: I grow my own fodder for my donkeys and needed a much more efficient and effective way to water my trays of seeds to growing fodder. This little sprayer is fantastic!! I can reach the back of the trays without pulling each one off the shelf, it's much easier to water evenly, and I can use the mist for the seeds without spreading them out. I purchased mine through the warehouse deals and it works perfectly. I've used it 3x daily since it arrived and I've not had a single problem.
customer_reviews.author: DonkeyMom

customer_reviews.title: bought it to clean screens and window frames
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to clean window screens (from the inside out) and window frames. It pumps up easily, and with adjustable spray, blows the dust off of the screens, and when the spray is more pin-point, easily dislodges and washes away dirt on the window frames. Also great to use to clean debris from under the hood, it's easy to avoid water on the electrical connectors.
customer_reviews.author: MatBo911

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, had it been complete.
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the box, I found that the complete nozzle assembly was missing. Since I already have 4 more of the same sprayers, I just saved this as a back-up in case one of the other containers breaks. Otherwise, the product would have been perfect. Just that Amazon should inspect their used products to assure that all parts are included.
customer_reviews.author: Jose A. Colon

customer_reviews.title: Great for houseplants!
customer_reviews.text: Great little sprayer for in house. It’s the perfect size - not to big that’s its hard to get tight places, but big enough that you are not refilling it every 2 seconds. Sprayer can be angled up or down and has a guard so it does all run down your arm. I’ve been using it to wash plants down with a homemade neem oil mix. Works excellently. It produces a nice mist for good coverage.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for spraying wood sealer and stain on new stockade fencing. I tried professional automotive spray gun, brushing and roller. This is the best method for me. The product I am spraying is a little thicker than water. I make sure It is cleaned after each use, replacing old fence a few panels at a time. This sprayer is cleaned with turpentine then with lacquer thinner, lubricate with wd40. Done that 6 times still working like new. You have to keep it pumped up for a good conical shape spray pattern, not hard to do. Also I doubt spraying latex paint unless thinned a lot, effectively turning the paint to a stain.
customer_reviews.author: Kilroy

customer_reviews.title: This is such a great hand sprayer!!
customer_reviews.text: Disclaimer, I don't use this for pesticides or sprays, I use this to egg wash buns at the restaurant I work at. 75% egg to 25% water. It works great to spray egg wash on bun, so quick and easy, better then brushing and better than spraying with a regular bottle. I'm sure this will work for almost anything you need it for, especially if it work well with eggs.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for seedlings
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough great things about this sprayer. I got it for seedlings. You can set the spray to a very fine mist for seeds, or stronger flow when they’ve grown big enough for more water but aren’t ready for a watering can. The cone helps keep overspray at bay. High quality plastic. You can adjust the direction of the spray head. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: scientific mom

customer_reviews.title: This review is not watered down, but the plants are, and that's the objective
customer_reviews.text: I use this to moisten bonsai. It is easy to use, does the job, easy to refill, easy to aim, and I could go on and on but you get the point by now. I use distilled water just because. Pump it up 30 times (easy to do) and you have enough oomph to spray maybe 50 plants over several days (it keeps the pressure up while sitting on the shelf.) Glad I made this pick.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great if you’re in a city apartment and need to clean up “presents” left at the door from people the night before
customer_reviews.text: Gets really good pressure from just a few pumps, holds a decent amount of water/cleaner/whatever. I’m using it to help clean off my bike after a dirty commute. It’s super useful if you’re in the city and people throw their leftovers/beer cans/human waste on your patio. If you don’t have a convenient hose hookup nearby it can be a real pain, this makes living in the trashier part of town a lot more tolerable if you like to keep the outside of your place relatively sanitary.
customer_reviews.author: Tu2

customer_reviews.title: totally recommend this mister!!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my indoor plants, outdoor sprouting vegetable garden, and my lizard. It’s doing triple duty like a pro, and what I like most of all is that I can fill the water basin 2 times and get all three (lizard, plants, garden sprouts) sprayed with a super fine mist. Not big droplets that are supposed to be a fine mist, but an ACTUAL fine mist. Is it pretty? No. But it saves me so much time and effort who needs pretty?
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Leaks after a few months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to spray diluted bleach on frequently touched areas in the office. At first I was delighted, it was handy, easy to use and just the right size. Now however, three months after first use, the spout is leaking everywhere and creates a mess. Maybe its bleach and its effect on plastic. I have to look for another sprayer now.
customer_reviews.author: J. Yap

customer_reviews.title: Great for directing spray to small areas, underside of leaves, directed areas
customer_reviews.text: Unlike large volume pump sprayers, the Solo 418 is easy to carry, pump, and operate. One nice feature is the spray guard which allows you spray small areas without overspray. I have used this spray on roses, hellebores, and weeds in ground cover with very good to excellent results. Considering the sprayer only holds a liter (a bit more than a quart), it seems to last for some time.
customer_reviews.author: pc in georgia

customer_reviews.title: Great Mister for Outdoor Use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sprayer to spray wettable-powder sulfur dust on some of my plants that are susceptible to powdery mildew. Every sprayer I've used in the past doesn't mist. You can adjust it and get from a direct stream to an uneven coarse spray but never a fine spray. But this one really does do a relatively fine mist, at least for an outdoor sprayer. Those tiny indoor ones would be useless outside.
customer_reviews.author: Am That I Am

customer_reviews.title: Love the way this works
customer_reviews.text: Love the way this works. It's easy to pump up the pressure & I only have to do it every couple days. The adjustable head angle is very helpful. Bought it to use as a mister for my gecko's habitat. It is used twice a day for that & functions flawlessly. Then it occurs to me this might be help for taking showers when camping. Tried it out at home first and... WOW! I took my usual full shower, shampoo, conditioner, shaving. It too only two liters. So I'm going to order a second sprayer for showering. It will be a great benefit for camping.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Seals Immediately Degraded, Check MSDS of Chemicals Before Using
customer_reviews.text: THE GOOD: All plastic parts seem to be made of polypropylene (tough, strong, very chemically resistant). Simple design for easy disassembly if necessary. Well-greased for smooth action right out of the box. THE BAD: All of the flexible seals degraded and the sprayer became unusable within a week. Viton, the seal material, is chemically resilient to many solvents. I mistakenly assumed brake cleaner would be fine, but many of the chemicals in the brake cleaner I used - ESPECIALLY acetone and toluene - are not compatible. SUMMARY: Look up the MSDS for whatever you're spraying and Google its chemical compatibility with Viton. RATING: 5/5 product, the seal failure was my own fault, everything else is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: george buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Well made product - for a while anyway
customer_reviews.text: I use this with a water and bleach solution to sanitize our shower stall. It works perfectly. I spray down the walls/door/floor. Mildew and scum are gone...takes no time at all. Stays pressurized without leaking. Highly recommended. 7/28/15 Update...I bought another one and it leaks at the pivot joint after just a few uses. My neighbor has one and it started leaking around the same joint after a few months using a bleach and water solution same as me. I'm concerned about the useful life of this product since this issue of leakage at the pivot joint behind the spray nozzle is generating complaints from users.
customer_reviews.author: PlanMan

customer_reviews.title: The nozzle tips break very easily
customer_reviews.text: I bough this in Sept 2019. I accidentally dropped the sprayer and the tip cracked. I thought since it was my fault, I would order some more tips from Solo. I bought 3 tips in November. Since then all 3 have broken in the same way, they cracked. I am not buying any more. It's time to move on to another brand.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for fungicide spray
customer_reviews.text: I use the sprayer to apply fungicide on my grape tree. When it is full (1 liter capacity), it is quite heavy to lift up especially I have to reach out high on the grape vine. I can imagine how heavy the 2-liter sprayer. My suggestion is to wash and clean the sprayer after each use. Do not let any chemical of anything sit in the bottle. The chemical may leave some kind of residue at the bottom which is hard or impossible to scrape. I have to throw away my first bottle because of this reason.
customer_reviews.author: Pikmin

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased!  You can feel the quality.
customer_reviews.text: I used the Solo to apply the 303 Fabric Guard to my boat cover and was very pleased with the performance and the results. Last year I cheaped out and used a roller and the results were not good. This year I spent the $ and purchased the Solo. The Solo is a solid unit that will last for years. Easy to clean and it does not take very much effort to pump it for pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time or money.
customer_reviews.text: What absolute garbage. Bought one, leaked after a week, returned for replacement, next one worked for 4 weeks, then leaked. Both leaked out of the top seal, spraying and dripping everywhere. Past the return date, so went in the garbage where it belongs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great time saver, comfortable to use!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny!!! I’ve been trying to make do with spraying our garden plants with a cheap hand sprayer from Walmart. I got a blister and it broke before I finished. Also, I had to bend over to reach the plants and it took forever. This sprayer handles soapy water like a dream, allows me to spray standing up, and I accomplished in 5 minutes what used to take me 1+hours. I love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Very nice sprayer!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for car degreaser/cleaner and I love the feature to move the nozzle up or down. I wish it could extend a little further after realizing I may need more reach, but I had an idea what I was getting before I got this. This thing is great for close range spray and coats nice and evenly. I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rio P

customer_reviews.title: Nice sprayer
customer_reviews.text: This is a small neat sprayer. I have terrible arthritis in hands and arms but am able to use this spray with no problem. Purchased thinking I might have a termite problem. Like the swivel head can close into cracks, plus projects some great distance when you spray. A great buy. Will buy another for weed killer. So nice to be able to be able to direct a spray with precision
customer_reviews.author: wanda holmes

customer_reviews.title: Eventual dissapointment
customer_reviews.text: Thoroughly disappointing. I used this item when it first arrived, and it worked well. I used a second time about 4 weeks later, and it worked very well. Several weeks later, I used it a third time and nothing happened. I pumped it up and nothing happened when I pulled the trigger. I certainly expected it to last more than 3 uses.
customer_reviews.author: DMW

customer_reviews.title: Mist and Blue goo
customer_reviews.text: I bought it originally for my hermit crabs tank so I could spray it easier. When it came in I decided I would try it out right away. I started to look at it and inspect if anything was wrong with it after reading one star ratings. I opened up the bar with the red circle on it and there was blue stuff that felt like Vaseline. I don’t know what it was but I cleaned it off with Q-tips after 4 minutes I finished. I don’t know what it was, but it was nasty.. Still using it other than that. Only downfall with the misting is that it’s more of a rough mist than an actual mist.
customer_reviews.author: ronya

customer_reviews.title: Awesome deal for a quality pump sprayer.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to apply ONR to my car for a rinseless wash. It sprays evenly and a few pumps affords you quite a bit of spray. It has a neck that bends so the jug stays upright. With a shield installed on the nozzle, it directs the spray where you need without getting you wet. Since ONR is non-volitile, I cannot attest to the pump's chemical resistance.
customer_reviews.author: D.S. McClure

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a mister for my hermit crab enclosure and using a spray bottle was killing my hand. Got this and it works AMAZING! Gave it about 25 pumps which was so easy to do and the mist lasted a good minute! Also another great thing about this product is the tip of the nossle, it rotates and there's different spray pressures. Absolutely worth the money and it works awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Alisha

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my deer repellant mixtur.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my needs. I spray a skunky mixture of ingreds.on my tomato plants and all the flower blossoms deer like to eat. Have arthritis in my fingers and this pump action is easy. and so is the spray.Wish I got this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Like this very much for what I purchased it for -- which is apply shower cleaner every morning. Can adjust the spray from fine mist to something stronger. I mix the shower cleaner with water (about 50/50) since it sprays much easier and more completely than the bottle's handheld sprayer. I can pump it up, completely spray my shower and then release the pressure and put away all in less than 2 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: cconnet

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this sprayer!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how I lived workout it. It is totally a game-changer. Saves my hands from repeated squeezing. Gives a super soft mist up to a heavy stream. Completely controllable in both streams and directions. You can even turn the spray end up to get the underside of the leaves. I highly recommend this sprayer!
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Wife loves it
customer_reviews.text: My 2 gallon sprayer was too heavy for my wife to use so we bought a small sprayer for her. This is our third try, the previous two brands we tried failed within a month. So far this sprayer has performed much better than the other, similarly priced, sprayers that we tried.
customer_reviews.author: Slowdog

customer_reviews.title: 5 years later...
customer_reviews.text: I've had the 1 liter spray bottle for 5 years now and never had any problems with it. It's been such a good little sprayer I just had to share this with others. I mainly use it for auto cleaning. Inbetween 2 bucket hand washes, I use this to spray car soap then knock the dirt off with a pressure washer. I have an auto foam sprayer that attaches to the pressure washer gun, but this works just as well and quicker imo.
customer_reviews.author: DIYdad

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Handle While On A Ladder
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. I used this to waterproof my chimney. Once pumped up, it sprayed the waterproofing w/out issue. I had to refill it more frequently than my larger sprayers but it was much easier to use while high up on the ladder spraying my chimney. This did exactly what I needed it to do & at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Spike

customer_reviews.title: ATTENTION THOSE WITH SEVERELY ARTHRITIC HANDS!
customer_reviews.text: This the sprayer for you! I have struggled for many years trying to find a sprayer that my useless hands can operate and depressurize and remove the top!! I use this only for insecticide. I pressurize according to the directions, spray the contents, then depress the spray trigger until the pressure is all released (less than a minute) and I can unscrew the top with ease! I am able to spray my own bugs and save thousands of dollars!
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: WOW what a Mister!!
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 birdcages and mist my birds every day. Having arthritis and hitting the plunger again and again on other bottles cause may hand to ache. This is sooo much better. Pump it eashily with your palm and when you feel a resistance it is ready. Beautiful lasing spray or you can give shorter but it is from Heaven for me. Super easy to spray and well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: NYgalinNJ

customer_reviews.title: solid little pump spray bottle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pump spray bottle for my microgreen farm. I use it for a organic mix for mold control. It is perfect. Small, but holds more than enough for a month at a time. Easy pumping. even fine spray. Compared to a lot of junk out there; this thing is actually solid in its construction and I think will actually last me a long time. Great purchase. Perfect for my little microgreen farm!~
customer_reviews.author: John Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Used to apply weater sealer and it worked great.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to apply water sealant on a patio. It had the correct solvent proof fittings. Worked great. Was easy to adjust the tip to get the perfect spray pattern. It held pressure great. After filling the tank I would pump it about 30 times. When the tank was about half, I would pump it another 20 times. That got me to a point when I needed to refill the tank. I through it away when I was done, so I don't know about cleanup and future use.
customer_reviews.author: TexasAV8R

customer_reviews.title: Never Use Regular Spray Bottles Again!
customer_reviews.text: This sprayer was perfect! Little did I know the spray head was adjustable, and my first job was to spray the underside of all my azalea leaves. All I did was pump up the sprayer, point the spray head up, and pull the trigger. It did all the work!
customer_reviews.author: BillATech11

customer_reviews.title: Small tank size, but just right
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something to water my plants indoors that wasn't one of the huge gallon sprayers. This has a better trigger mechanism than the larger sprayers available at home stores. The trigger doesn't get stuck in the on position the way those other ones do. I removed the clearish plastic funnel over the nozzle that's meant to reduce blowback—I didn't see the point. It just unscrews.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kunz

product_meta.title: Solo 418 One-Hand Pressure Sprayer, 1-Liter, Ergonomic Grip for Gardening, Fertilizing, Cleaning & General Use Spraying
product_meta.description: 1-Liter one-hand pressure sprayer. Solo one-hand sprayers are perfect for small jobs in and around the home. These lightweight and versatile sprayers are perfect for general spraying indoors and out, weed control, gardening, auto & marine, livestock applications and more.chemicals need to be emptied from the sprayer when not in use and release the pressure in order to ensure proper working
feature_bullets: TIGHT SEAL-chemicals can be harsh and most times bad for your health. Solo has created a sprayer with Viton gaskets and O-rings to help keep the chemicals in
UNIQUE DRIFT/DRIP GUARDS-allows for a more controlled spray when applying chemicals to the areas you need
REDUCES HAND FATIGUE-Solo incorporated a lock-on trigger to this one-handed sprayer, knowing that comfortability matters when using your hands
LIGHT WEIGHT SPRAYER-makes it easy to carry around for tackle all your needs
OUTDOOR APPLICATIONS-the Solo 418 one-liter can be used for gardening, weed control, auto cleaning, and mildew/algae
INDOOR APPLICATIONS-this sprayer can be used for showers/sinks, lubrication, and wood working
MARINE APPLICATIONS-the 418 Solo sprayer can help apply bilge cleaners, disinfections, and even help apply water proofing chemicals
EASY TO USE-just fill the one-liter with the correct liquid/water mixture, stoke 30x to pressurize the tank, and unlock tiger to start spraying

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,893 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
